bibl.title: Harry Greenwald v. F.D. Simmons. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Superior Court of the State of Washington for King County
In the Matter of Applicatin of Harry Greenwald
Filed in the United States District Court
In the Matter of the Application of Harry Greenwald for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
State of Washington County of King
TO THE HONORABLE JUDGE OF SAID COURT:

Jennie Greenwald being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says, that she is the wife of the petitioner Harry Greenwald, and that she is the wife of the petitioner Harry Greenwald, and that she makes this application for the petitioner for the reason that the said petitioner is now imprisoned and detained in the City Jail of the City of Seattle, King County, State of Washington, by the Federal Authorities, to-wit: at the request of F.D. Simons, agent in charge of the department of justice.

That the said agent in charge of the Department of Justice is about to remove said petitioner to the State of California. That the said petitioner is illegally imprisoned and detained of his liberty by theaforesaid F.D. Simons and other agents of the Department of Justice, without any just or legal process or authority of law whatsoever. That no complaint has been lodged against him; that there is no just or legal cause against him, and he has been confined and so imprisoned for more than one day.

That the said petitioner is not held in the aforesaid city jail, in the County of King, at the request of F.D. Simons, agent in charge of the department of justice, for any process issued by court of common jurisdiction, nor held for any process or order for any contempt ofcourt officer or body having authority to commit or hold him, nor upon any warrant issued by any court of this state, nor upon indictment or information in this State, or within the Western District of Washington, northern Division, nor is there any lawful or valid reason for the imprisonment of said petitioner.

That the said petitioner is held by the aforesaid F.D. Simmons upon the alleged ground as follows, to-wit: That the said F.D. Simons, agent in charge of the Department of Justice, and as such agent of the Department of Justice, received a certain communication by telegraph, the contents of which is unknown to this petitioner, but he has been informed that he would be immediately removed to the State of California and charged with an offense the nature of which has not been disclosed to this petitioner.

Your petitioner further avers that at no time did he reside in the State of California; that he resided in the State of Washington for the last ten (10) years; that he has committed no crimes within the State of California, to which state he is about to be taken and accused of a crime, the nature of which is wholly unknown to him.

That your petitioner is not now accused of any violation of any law of the State of Washington or the United States; that the detention of your petitioner is altogether illegal, arbitrary, and withou any legal reason or excuse.

(1) That a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of this court, directed to F.D. Simons, agent in charge of the Department of Justice, at whose request your petitioner is held and detained in the City jail, command and require said F.D. Simons, agent in charge of the Department of Justice, to bring the body of your petitioner before this court on some special convenient day, to be determined by thiscourt, then and there to show cause why your petitioner is detained of his liberties and why he should not be fortwith and immediately released and discharged from said custody.
(2) That the pending of the return of this writ at a date so to be fixed by this court to assure his appearance at the said return day.
(3) That your petitioner be discharged from said custody and have such other and further relief as the court may deem just.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of June, 1919.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
